__TOC__

<nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Lubuntu-fake-PAE|Return to Lubuntu-fake-PAE]]</nowiki>
----
Lubuntu-fake-PAE offers a method to install Lubuntu 13.04 into computers (mainly if not only laptops) with Pentium M and Celeron M CPUs. Most if not all of these CPUs have PAE capability, but show no PAE flag. This means that these machines can not use any Lubuntu versions after 12.04 and therefore, Lubuntu 12.10 and Lubuntu 13.04 can not be installed and their kernels can not be upgraded, because the software is checking for the PAE flag. This can be fixed with <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Lubuntu-fake-PAE|fake-PAE]]</nowiki>

----
==== Commands ====
<pre>
cat /proc/cpuinfo
uname -a
lsb_release -a
cpuid
</pre>

==== Comparing the commands for Lubuntu 12.04.2 and 13.04 side by side ====
<nowiki>[[File:t12b.txt]]</nowiki>

==== Lubuntu 12.04 upgraded to 12.04.2 ====
<pre>
guru@usb-lub:~$ cat /proc/cpuinfo
processor	: 0
vendor_id	: GenuineIntel
cpu family	: 6
model		: 13
model name	: Intel(R) Pentium(R) M processor 1.70GHz
stepping	: 6
microcode	: 0x18
cpu MHz		: 600.000
cache size	: 2048 KB
...
wp		: yes
flags		: fpu vme de pse tsc msr mce cx8 mtrr pge mca cmov clflush dts acpi mmx fxsr sse sse2 ss tm pbe up bts est tm2
bogomips	: 1198.93
...
address sizes	: 32 bits physical, 32 bits virtual

guru@usb-lub:~$ uname -a
Linux usb-lub 3.2.0-41-generic #66-Ubuntu SMP Thu Apr 25 03:28:09 UTC 2013 i686 i686 i386 GNU/Linux
guru@usb-lub:~$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 12.04.2 LTS
Release:	12.04
Codename:	precise
</pre>

</pre>
